Guardian Safety needs access to your location to provide emergency services with your exact position during emergencies and to calculate safety scores for your area.
Guardian Safety requires continuous location access to track your safety in real-time, share your location with emergency contacts, and provide immediate assistance during emergencies.
Guardian Safety monitors your location continuously to ensure your safety and can automatically alert emergency contacts if you're in danger.
Guardian Safety uses your camera to capture emergency evidence, scan QR codes for location sharing, and document incidents for safety reports.
Guardian Safety needs microphone access to record emergency audio, capture voice notes during incidents, and enable voice-activated emergency features.
Guardian Safety accesses your photo library to save emergency evidence, safety reports, and share location images with emergency contacts.
Guardian Safety saves emergency photos and safety documentation to your photo library for future reference and evidence.
Guardian Safety accesses your contacts to easily add emergency contacts and send safety alerts to your trusted network during emergencies.
Guardian Safety monitors your device motion to detect potential falls, accidents, or unusual movement patterns that may indicate an emergency.
Guardian Safety uses Face ID to provide secure, quick access to emergency features while keeping your safety information protected.
Guardian Safety can access your health data to provide emergency responders with critical medical information during emergencies.
Guardian Safety updates your health data with emergency incident information and safety metrics for medical reference.
Guardian Safety uses Bluetooth to detect emergency beacons, connect with safety devices, and communicate with nearby emergency responders.
Guardian Safety broadcasts emergency signals via Bluetooth to help emergency responders locate you and connect with safety devices.
